intro: Paneguia striata, commonly known as the striped paneguia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves with distinctive longitudinal stripes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Paneguia striata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
